intro: Lacunaria minor, commonly known as the lesser lacunaria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small, yellow or orange, and it produces small, bead-like fruits. Lacunaria minor is often found in open habitats and is a component of the local flora in its native range.
